story.title: The Christmas Sweater - Episode 7
story.storyDescription: Ever since her motherâ€™s death, Noelle hasnâ€™t wanted to go home for the holidays. But perhaps a bit of holiday magic is all she needsâ€¦
story.creator: web-uploader

messages.text: Aunt Beatrice?!
What are you muttering, dear?
Noelle canâ€™t pry her eyes off Lawrence.
Nothing. I â€”I have to go!
Oh, but my nephew Lawrence just got here!
Heâ€™s in town for the wedding.
Beatrice leans in conspiratorially.
And heâ€™s single too.
Noelle feels herself blush.
Oh, honey, nowâ€™s not the time to be shy!
Lawrence would do well to land a young woman like you.
Beautiful, successful, raised by wonderful peopâ€”
Iâ€™m sorry, Beatrice, but I really have to go.
I told Maria Iâ€™d meet her atâ€¦
Noelle looks down at her watch to pick a convincing fake time.
Noon.
Oh dear! Then youâ€™re quite a bit late.
Hurry on â€” there will be other opportunities to meet Lawrence properly.
Weâ€™ll just tell himâ€¦
Beatrice doesnâ€™t finish her sentence because Noelle is already halfway out the backdoor of the shop.
Oh, for goodness sakes! You can go out the normal entrance!
But Noelle keeps striding forward, keeping her back toward Lawrence.
Good-bye!
She races home.
She does her familyâ€™s secret knock on the side door.
And Maria opens it frantically.
Whatâ€™s wrong? Did you get in an argument with Beatrice?
No, itâ€™s not that.
She and I actually had a great conversation. Itâ€™s justâ€”
Noelleâ€™s dad walks into the room.
Whatâ€™s this I hear?
Things went well with Beatrice?
Despite the low-grade panic in the back of her mind, Noelle canâ€™t help but smile at her dad.
Dad! Were you eavesdropping?!
Guilty as charged.
Itâ€™s not every day you hear that your estranged daughter makes amends with your fiancÃ©e.
Aww, Dad. Estranged?
Is that really how you see me?
Noelle moves toward her father and wraps him in a hug.
Her face presses into his woolen sweater.
And her voice is muffled when she speaks.
Iâ€™m sorry I ever made you feel that way.
She pulls back from the hug to look her dad in the eyes.
I was sad and confused when Mom died.
And I think some part of me was â€˜defending her honorâ€™ with this whole Beatrice thing.
Iâ€™m so sorry, Dad, for everything.
I want you to be happy.
And I want to support you and Beatrice.
And I want to be here now, as your daughterâ€”
If youâ€™ll have me.
Donâ€™t be silly, Noelle. Of course Iâ€™ll have you.
Youâ€™ll always be my daughter.
After all â€” how would we celebrate the holidays without the Christmas Queen?
Noelle laughs.
I was hoping I could reclaim my throne!
Noelleâ€™s dad laughs with her.
Excellent. Iâ€™ll leave you to start working on those Christmas plans.
He heads back toward his study, but then spins back around at the last moment.
Oh andâ€¦could you make those peanut butter cookies I like so much?
The ones with the Reeseâ€™s peanut butter cups in the middle?
Noelle canâ€™t help but grin.
I was already planning on it, Dad.
Good.
When Noelleâ€™s dad is out of earshot, Noelle grabs her sisterâ€™s wrist.
Ow!
Shhh! I need to tell you something.
What?
The weirdest thing happened to me.
You know the guy I met at the airport?
Yeahâ€¦
Heâ€™s here! In Portsmouth.
Oh my gosh! Thatâ€™s great â€” where did you see him?
At the coffee shop.
Maria squeals.
Shh! Thatâ€™s not even the half of it.
Uh oh. What happened?
Did you turn him down?
Noelle, come on, at least agree to go out to dinner with the guy.
I did.
Maria squeals again.
Noelle shoots her a look, and Maria covers her mouth with her hand.
Her eyes still dance with glee.
Donâ€™t get too excitedâ€¦
I canâ€™t go.
Maria rolls her eyes.
Youâ€™re seriously giving me heart palpitations with all this back and forth.
Why canâ€™t you go?
Because heâ€™s Beatriceâ€™s NEPHEW. I saw him at her shop.
WHAT?!
I know, right?! Itâ€™s way too weird.
No itâ€™s not!
Itâ€™s perfect!
What?
Come on, if heâ€™s related to Beatrice, heâ€™s got to be a good guy andâ€¦
Oh my gosh!
What?
Youâ€™re wearing the sweater!
What?
The magical Christmas sweater.
You were wearing it when you ran into him today!
That means itâ€™s fate.
Come on, Noelle, you can trust the sweater.
She puts her hand on Noelleâ€™s knee.
And him.
Maria reaches up and grasps Noelleâ€™s hand.
Itâ€™s like Mom chose him.
I donâ€™t knowâ€¦
Donâ€™t you think itâ€™s all just a little too cookie-cutter?
I mean, I finally come to terms with the fact that dad is marrying our family friendâ€¦
Only to fall head over heels in love with her ridiculously hot nephew?
Whoa. No one said anything about â€œhead over heelsâ€ or â€œridiculously hot.â€
Maria gives Noelle a look that pierces through her defensive act.
Youâ€™re TOTALLY into this guy.
Noelle sighs.
Okay, fine. I totally am.
I guess the truth is that Iâ€™m really nervous.
It seems like nothingâ€™s gone right for me in five yearsâ€¦
So itâ€™s hard to believe that this wonâ€™t crash and burn like everything else.
Oh, Noelleâ€¦
Maria looks askance at her big sister.
You ran, didnâ€™t you?
What?
When you saw him just now, did you run away?
Noelle bows her head.
Ugh, yeah. I literally ran out the back door of the shop before he could see me.
Why is that always my first reaction?
Itâ€™s okay. You donâ€™t need to beat yourself up.
Just go back to the book shop and tell this ridiculously hot guyâ€”
Wait, what was his name?
Lawrence.
Maria goes stock still.
Her eyes fill with tears.
Lawrence? Likeâ€¦Lauren?
Like Momâ€™s name?
Yeah.
Oh, Noelle. Thatâ€™s such a good sign.
Mom is with you. Justâ€¦
Hurry!
Go to Beatriceâ€™s shop to talk to him.
So, for the second time that day, Noelle takes off at a sprint.
But for the first time in five yearsâ€¦
She seems to be running toward something wonderful.
